content:
I'm test-deploying here #14434, which changes the icons used for the sidebar menus (previously chevrons) to vertical ellipses, which among other things will avoid confusion that the chevrons might open the stream. Feedback appreciated, both on the change and its details (click targets, positioning, etc.).

If we like how this works, I assume we'll change the chevron menus in message bodies as well.

Hi,
not sure if this a value-able feedback
I think we should change the way it's highlighted when hover on it, since it's thin as compared to chevron so the Highlight maybe a shadow box will make more noticeable also in Users Sidebar there is no Highlight when Hover maybe should be added

I not sure that looks good or matches with the overall design
Or I might be confusing with what you are trying to convey
Can you show some example or use chrome-dev tool for quick prototyping?...that will be helpful

Also the chevrons were vertically aligned with each other, which was nice; this looks broken:
image.png
I think we just need to move the stream-level ones to the left.
Right sidebar vertical alignment looks off; they're a bit above center.
I agree a shadow box would not look great.

Tim Abbott said:

Also the chevrons were vertically aligned with each other, which was nice; this looks broken:

I did that intentionally...just to represent the lower level
Should I make it align?
Yeah, we intentionally aligned the chevrons, and I think it looks better that way. (Also, the further-right version doesn't feel good when the scrollbar is visible)
image.png

I believe this PR will fix that https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14267
There is no scrollbar overlap on the right sidebar

Tim Abbott said:

Right sidebar vertical alignment looks off; they're a bit above center.

At 100% view in chrome its pixel-perfect center.
I see alignment issue when zoomed in chrome
@Tim Abbott
Like can be nociable at 110%
100.png 110.png

while it better but not much noticeable that the click is on this rather than it will on the stream or topic what I'm suggesting is something like this
image.png
of course minus this color I just added it to be more obvious
I don't think so that's a kind of change we want...but let's see what others think
on the Users sidebar even the part where it gets darker is not available it stays the same wither the mouse is on it or not which is not very convenient

Siddharth said:

I don't think so that's a kind of change we want...but let's see what others think

me too

Hayder Sinan said:

on the Users sidebar even the part where it gets darker is not available it stays the same wither the mouse is on it or not which is not very convenient

It does...I just checked
Oh wait it's not happening in light mode
I'm on light
Ahh...just checked the master its not getting dark in a light mode with chevron we use before
yes I have tried on my installation you're right in light it doesn't on my installation i'm using dark which is why I didn't notice it
will fix that in a separate commit..thanks for reporting
not at all thank you
Noticed one more thing...All messages and Starred messages menu icons have slightly different color as compare to others
in night mode as well

I am summing up bugs/issue we have so far

  • Alignment issue of topic menu-icon as compare to stream menu-icon
  • Vertical alignment issue in right sidebar-menu-icon(Not sure about it yet)
  • Hover effect in right sidebar-menu-icon in light mode
  • Scrollbar overlap makes hard to click the menu-icon in left-sidebar (Possible fix #14267)
  • menu-icon colors for All messages and Starred messages
Will fix them tomorrow...going to bed
Do we have an icon that's 3 circular dots? The square dots feel out of place with the slightly curved edges on almost all of our UI elements.
@Rohitt Vashishtha as far as I can remember about that discussion, the circular dots are only available with font awesome v5. This is the only available icon for the version we use.

This is what you want I hope? -
https://fontawesome.com/icons/ellipsis-v
And how painful is the upgrade process? Yes, that looks nice.
There were some issues Tim mentioned I guess. Wait I'll get the convo.
https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/preview.20icon/near/850337
I assume a unicode ellipsis is inadequate? (ah - vertical required!)

There was this too:
https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/65-checkins/topic/Aditya/near/591410

Comparison:

image.png
Its pretty minor, but somehow the eyes catch it immediately.
That definitely is much better.
And given that it's used in multiple places makes all the difference.
Yeah it looks more like circle
What icon is that?
<i class="fas fa-ellipsis-v"></i>
FA v5
The same one Vaibhav linked, I just copied it as an SVG path from the site.
Depending on the license, we could just grab it and use alongside our existing FA.
Oh its v5
Another issue with this icon is that the click area feels smaller because of its shape.

But we have a larger area for click target
You don't need to be explicitly on the icon to get the click behaviour

Rohitt Vashishtha said:

Depending on the license, we could just grab it and use alongside our existing FA.

Found this on FA website

Remember, don't cross the streams or versions!
After conferring with Dr. Spengler, we don't recommend using Font Awesome 4 and 5 side-by-side on a project. It will cause huge CSS and path collisions and we can't promise icons will render as you or we expect. Its the equivalent of dogs and cats living together - total chaos. If you can't remove older version references, we recommend using a kit with version 4 compatibility enabled to help navigate collisions.

That's why I said "feels".

BTW how does this look?

image.png
Ellipsis anyday
That doesn't look good

we don't recommend using Font Awesome 4 and 5 side-by-side on a project

This wouldn't apply if we have 1 single hardcoded icon from FA5 as an SVG path in some HTML. I really like the finish of the round ellipsis.
Yes, rounded one really look good
Yeah, let's do the rounded one.

Agreed that we can just ship that SVG; we can use the common assets in:
./static/assets/icons/zulip-icons.font.js
(Look at how bot.svg in that directory works; I think you can just add another .svg file there and it'll be loaded properly)
on it

Screenshot-from-2020-04-30-05-34-33.png
This is how it looks
I named the file as ellipsis-v-solid.svg
Alignment looks a bit off for the topics; maybe 1px to the left of where it should be?

It's just a difference of 1px if I move 1px right it will look a pixel off from left
Screenshot-from-2020-04-30-05-43-28.png
That new screenshot looks aligned to me.
Ok will go with that

We may want to do the alignment CSS using a strategy that communicates "center this within this region" rather than a specific number of pixels; I wouldn't be surprised if what you have breaks under zoom in/out.
yeah vertical alignment is beaking under zoom in/out...will take care of that in final version
Currently redeploying this change replacing chevron menus with vertical ellipses; feedback appreciated.
I like it. Makes more sense (chevron looks like it should fold out the item, but the popup is placed elsewhere).

The vertical ellipses suffer from the same problem as the message_controls on mobile web, (see second bug heading on #13642).
I suspect that the vertical ellipses have just made this bug more noticeable by expanding the click target.
